abstract: Volcker rule, one of the flagship provisions of the financial regulatory overhaul, begins to take shape as regulators propose rules to limit the ability of most banks and Wall Street firms to use their own funds to buy and sell stocks, corporate bonds and derivatives; rules prohibit firms from taking outside risks.
snippet: The rules, part of the Dodd-Frank law, are intended to limit the ability of banks with government guarantees and Fed borrowing privileges to take outsize risks.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

lead_paragraph: The rules, part of the Dodd-Frank law, are intended to limit the ability of banks with government guarantees and Fed borrowing privileges to take outsize risks.

headline.main: Regulators to Set Forth Volcker Rule
headline.print_headline: Regulators To Set Forth Volcker Rule
headline.seo: Volcker Rule to Take Shape This Week
